intro: Duhaldea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plants typically have slender stems and heart-shaped leaves, often growing in moist, shady environments. Duhaldea species are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and North America. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in garden settings.
